name: Introduction to Computer Networking
introduction: Welcome to the demo of our Networking Fundamentals course.

modules.name: Welcome to ToyNet!
modules.introduction: Learn about Project Reclass and ToyNet in this module.

submodules.name: Course Introduction
submodules.introduction: Get to know our primary course instructor and Chief Technology Officer of Project Reclass, Tay Nishimura.

submodules.name: Introductory Video
submodules.introduction: Watch a short video on Project Reclass and this learning platform, ToyNet.

submodules.name: Motivation
submodules.introduction: How does a file move from computer to computer? Let's revisit why we need computer networks in the first place.

submodules.name: Network Emulator Lab
submodules.introduction: Checkout this interactive lab tool we developed on top of Mininet, an enterprise network emulator developed at Stanford!

modules.name: Life of a Network Packet
modules.introduction: Computer need to move lots of information (e.g. emailed files, social media interactions, video streams) from one device to another. Whether itâ€™s through WiFi or over some kind of cable, computers communicate with a series of bits (0s and 1s) in tiny chunks at a time. The most common way of sending these tiny chunks is with a packet. This module is all about packets!

submodules.name: Who are you?
submodules.introduction: First we want to know a little about you so we can make this program even better for you and other other learns.

submodules.name: Integrity
submodules.introduction: At Project Reclass, we are not just focused on what we build but also how we build it. We routinely reflect on values espoused by our military branches, and reflect on what these values mean to us. Throughout your course, we welcome you to do the same!

submodules.name: Network Protocols
submodules.introduction: This lecture covers the intuition behind the communication mechanism used by every compute device connected to the internet.

submodules.name: Fiber Optics in the Sea
submodules.introduction: Ever wondered how underwater cables are laid? We take a trip on the ship that keeps us online.

submodules.name: Connecting Devices
submodules.introduction: So we now understand why and how we can connect devices through computer networks. Let's give it a try in our hands-on lab!

submodules.name: Life of a Network Packet
submodules.introduction: Great job on finishing Module 1! Before you move on, take this quick quiz to make sure you understood the material so we can set you up for success with the rest of this curriculum!

modules.name: Career Chat
modules.introduction: To understand how it works today, it is helpful to understand how and why it was created as well as how it has evolved over the decades. This module takes you on a journey through half a century of innovations which went into our modern world-wide web.

submodules.name: Veteran Transitioning into Software Engineering
submodules.introduction: Watch one of members talk about their transition from active military service to the tech industry.

modules.name: History of the Internet
modules.introduction: To understand how computer networks works today, it is helpful to understand how and why they were created as well as how they has evolved over the decades.

modules.name: Industry Chat
modules.introduction: To understand how it works today, it is helpful to understand how and why it was created as well as how it has evolved over the decades. This module takes you on a journey through half a century of innovations which went into our modern world-wide web.

submodules.name: Industry Panel
submodules.introduction: Although most people work for comapnies that aim to make a lot of money, there are a lot of opportunities to give back to the community in ways you care about through working for a nonprofit. Learn how these professionals from all walks of life come together to help formerly incarcerated individuals pave new career paths after serving their sentence.
